questions.question: [C#/.NET] "Boxing", in .NET, is the process of storing primitive data type values as:
[C#/.NET] What is the language Silverlight uses for structuring its user interface content?
[C#/.NET] Does C# have Garbage Collection? If yes, what is it?
answers: C# does NOT have garbage collection
C# HAS garbage collection, which is a function in Visual Studio for cleaning up your source code
C# HAS garbage collection, which is an automatic process in the CLR which frees unused (unreachable) memory during program execution.
C# HAS garbage collection, which is a compiler feature that removes unused code

questions.question: [Web Services, WCF and SOA] What is the Windows Communcation Foundation?
answers: It is a part of the .Net framework that is used for creating Graphical User Interfaces
It is the network part of the .NET framework
It is a unified platform for distributed computing using .NET
It is a class library for Instant Messaging for .NET
It is the system used by Microsoft to communicate on the Internet

questions.question: [Web Services, WCF and SOA] What is wrong with the following web method if you are going to write a C# Web Service?
answers: All Web methods need a return of type String [1]
All Web methods need String inputs [2]
Web methods need to be public, but this one is private [3]
The [WebMethod] attribute is wrong, it should read [WebService] [4]

questions.question: [Web Services, WCF and SOA] Select the best option for relating an XML-scheme with an XML file

[WWF] Windows workflow Runtime Engine has some extensions. Persistence is one of them. This service ensures that
answers: Workflow keeps running in the background in a separate thread
Workflow state can be saved/retrieved to/from a database
Workflow errors can be caught, hence used for exception handling.
Workflow terminates in a required procedure.

questions.question: [RTC] Real Time Communication is...
[SemWeb Intro] Which form of terminology models is not suitable for representing associations between concepts?
[SemWeb Intro] What form of interoperability is supported by XML?
[SemWeb Intro] What is normally not represented by URIs in RDF triples?
[SemWeb Intro] Which of these statements are correct?
answers: RDFS provides a formal semantics for XML
RDFS is a serialization of OWL
OWL ontologies may include RDFS statements
RDFS specifies the instances of OWL ontologies

questions.question: [SemWeb Intro] What is not true about ontologies?
answers: Ontologies are explicit specifications of conceptualizations
Ontologies  are algorithmic specifications of domain phenomena

questions.question: [RDF Modelling] What is not a predefined class name in RDFS?
[RDF Modelling] When do you normally use blank nodes in RDFS?
answers: Specifying resources that have unknown URIs
Specifying resources hidden to SPARQL queries

questions.question: [OWL Modelling] What is not correct about owl:Thing?
answers: Every individual of the ontology is an instance of owl:Thing
Every class of the ontology is a subclass of owl:Thing
Every property of the ontology is a subproperty of owl:Thing

questions.question: [OWL Modelling] What are the three basic modeling primitives in OWL?
[OWL Modelling] How would you model a hasBiologicalFather property in OWL
[Semantics and Reasoning] An interpretation in Description Logic is defined by means of a domain D and an interpretation function I.  How are concepts interpreted?
answers: Concepts are mapped onto subsets of D
Concepts are mapped onto elements of D
Concepts are mapped onto binary relations over D
Concepts are mapped onto triples of elements of D

questions.question: [Semantics and Reasoning] What is a model of an ontology?
answers: An interpretation with a non-empty interpretation domain
An interpretation that assigns unique domain elements to all individuals of the ontology
An interpretation that satisfies all axioms in the ontology
An interpretation that associate concepts to all individuals

questions.question: [Ontology Engineering and Quality] What does it mean that an ontology is unsatisfiable?
answers: The ontology is not shared by all stakeholders
There are no individuals in the ontology
There is at least one individual that is an instance of more than one class
There are indefinitely many models of the ontology
There is no possible world in which all statements of the ontology hold

questions.question: [Ontology Engineering and Quality] What is not true about coherent ontologies?
answers: An incoherent ontology is always inconsistent
A consistent ontology can be incoherent
An inconsistent ontology is always incoherent
A coherent ontology does not contain inconsistent classes

questions.question: [Ontology Engineering and Quality] What is not a typical mistake in ontology modeling?
answers: The direction of roles (properties) is wrongly modeled
Top-most class in ontology is not included
Part-of relations are modeled as subclasses
Domains and ranges of properties are too specific

questions.question: [Ontology Engineering and Quality] hich ontology is most likely to change?
